dfischer.proxysniffer

Class RecorderURLBlacklistConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.proxysniffer.RecorderURLBlacklistConfig

  • public class RecorderURLBlacklistConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    URL blacklist configuration for the proxy recorder. The configuration is an ASCII file that contains on each line an URL or a fragment of an URL with wildcards, followed by a blacklist action (separated by a white space). The wildcard '*' is supported for URLs an can be used multiple times inside the same URL. The following blacklist action are supported
    • abort : abort the network connection to the web client
    • <status-code-number>> : send a response with the corresponding HTTP status code (w/o content data)
    • webbugimage : send as response a 1x1 transparent image with a 200 OK status code
    Lines that are stating with a # hash char are not considered (commented out).
    Note: In case of any match to an URL the web client request will not be recorded.
    Since:
    V5.2-U
    See Also:
    RecorderURLWhitelistConfig, RecorderURLRegexBlacklistConfig, RecorderURLRegexWhitelistConfig, RecorderBlacklistConfig, RecorderWhitelistConfig

      • RecorderURLBlacklistConfig

        public RecorderURLBlacklistConfig(java.lang.String jsonData)
                           throws org.json.JSONException
        Create a new instance based on JSON data. Example:
         {"RecorderURLBlacklist":[{"*.google.*":"webbugimage"},{"http://*.nothingforme.ch/*":"abort"},{"*www.tracking.com/images/*":"404"}]}
        Parameters:
        jsonData - the JSON data
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • RecorderURLBlacklistConfig

         "*.google.* webbugimage"
 "http://*.nothingforme.ch/* abort"
 "*www.tracking.com/images/* 404"
        Parameters:
        textfileData - the text file data

      • getBlacklistMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,RecorderBlacklistAction> getBlacklistMap()
        Get the URL blacklist.
        Returns:
        the blacklist. Key = DNS-Name or an IP address (may contain wildcards), Value = corresponding blacklist action

      • getBlacklistAction

        public RecorderBlacklistAction getBlacklistAction(java.lang.String url)
        Check if an URL match to the blacklist.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to check
        Returns:
        result of blacklist check
        See Also:
        RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_NIL, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_ABORT, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_HTTP_CODE, RecorderBlacklistAction.BLACKLIST_ACTION_WEBBUGIMAGE

      • readFromFile

        public void readFromFile(java.io.File f)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Read the URL blacklist configuration from a file. Note: no error is thrown if the file does not exists - in such a case the blacklist configuration will be cleared (empty).
        Parameters:
        f - the file that contains the URL blacklist configuration
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
